metadata.title: CVE-2018-10933 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in libssh's server-side state machine beforeversions 0.7.6 and 0.8.4. A malicious client could create channels withoutfirst performing authentication, resulting in unauthorized access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh-4 - 0.6.1-0ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libssh package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.1-0ubuntu3.4').
